title: Gallery

title: Gallery
text: NOTE: 3 densities plot can get cluttered. change plot type violin plots jittered box plots alternative ways displaying densities depicted following tabset help reduce clutter.

title: Gallery
text: NOTE: making histogram, always explore multiple bin widths. addition, avoid overlapping histograms can confused stacked bar charts.

title: Gallery
text: NOTE: Adding jittered points box plot useful see underlying distribution data.

title: Gallery
text: NOTE: single line one can also fill area curve solid color. choice can emphasize trend data, visually separates area curve area .

title: Gallery
text: NOTE: multiple time series danger visualizing spaghetti chart. Hence, one technique reduce mental load directly label lines since matching multiple lines legend cumbersome. Alternatively, clutter overwhelming following tabset presents techniques plot multiple series.

title: Gallery
text: NOTE: Consider type chart attempt visualize evolution whole relative proportions group. However, use stacked charts cautiously since can hard read due moving baselines.

title: Gallery
text: NOTE: second plot shows common problem scatter plots, namely overplottling. following tabset alternatives present easy workarounds. categorical variable present common techniques facetting highlighting apply.

title: Gallery
text: NOTE: differences values encoded bubble size harder perceive differences values encoded position. Hence, “--chart” alternative. addition, one can also opt correlogram described next section. Besides, bubble charts can also suffer overplotting.

title: Gallery
text: NOTE: three four quantiative variables, --scatter plot matrices quickly become unwieldy. case, useful quantify amount association pairs variables visualize quantity rather raw data.

title: Gallery
text: NOTE: One rearrange bars, natural ordering categories. Whenever natural ordering (.e. categorical variable ordered factor) one keep original ordering visualization.  bars similar length visually less appealing use bar plots (“Moire effect”). case, one can resort use Lollipop charts.

title: Gallery
text: NOTE: multiple groups subgroups comparison gets difficult across within. bars. addition, clutter plot increases. Two alternatives bar chart presented .

title: Gallery
text: NOTE: barplot best alternative pie plots. However, example shows similar shares still difficult compare within across categories. example, side side bar charts better choice visualize proportions.

Meaningful titles (mirrors statworx PowerPoint slides)  2. Choose appropriate scale y- x-axis.  3. necessary provide source data  4. Label axis  5. Include legend  6. title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {statThemes: Provides Themes For Ggplot2 Graphics},   author = {{person}},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/STATWORX/statThemes}, }

title: Provides Themes For Ggplot2 Graphics
text: goal package enhance consistency graphics across company

title: Provides Themes For Ggplot2 Graphics
text: can install development version statThemes GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("STATWORX/statThemes")

title: Provides Themes For Ggplot2 Graphics
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(statThemes) #> Lade nötiges Paket: ggplot2  col_list <- c("#0000BF", "#9BAEC1", "#9999FF")  ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Width, Sepal.Length, color = Species)) +   geom_point(size = 2) + labs(title = "Lorem ipsum",                               subtitle = "Consetetur Sadipscing Elitr") +   scale_color_statworx(palette = "custom", col_list = col_list) + statworx_classic()

title: Provides Themes For Ggplot2 Graphics
text: gallery contains multiple graphics common scenarios also guidelines improve data visualizations. can find .

what: Wrap color vector in function. — create_color_vector

text: Wrap color vector function.

title: Wrap color vector in function. — create_color_vector
code: create_color_vector(colors = statworx_highlights, ...)

title: Wrap color vector in function. — create_color_vector
text: colors List colors ... Name color "statworx_highlights"

title: Wrap color vector in function. — create_color_vector
text: Hex code color

what: Create a color palette function. — create_statworx_palette
title: Create a color palette function. — create_statworx_palette
text: Create color palette function.

title: Create a color palette function. — create_statworx_palette
code: create_statworx_palette(   palette = "statworx_standards_1",   reverse = FALSE,   col_list = "",   ... )

title: Create a color palette function. — create_statworx_palette
text: palette color palette "custom". reverse true, order palette reversed. col_list Provide vector colors @param palette = "custom". ... arguments passed colorRampPalette

title: Create a color palette function. — create_statworx_palette
text: Palette generating function based "colorRampPalette".

what: Create a constructor for ggplot for lines, points, etc. — scale_color_statworx
title: Create a constructor for ggplot for lines, points, etc. — scale_color_statworx
text: Create constructor ggplot lines, points, etc.

title: Create a constructor for ggplot for lines, points, etc. — scale_color_statworx
code: scale_color_statworx(   palette = "statworx_standards_1",   discrete = TRUE,   reverse = FALSE,   col_list = c(),   ... )

title: Create a constructor for ggplot for lines, points, etc. — scale_color_statworx
text: palette color palette. discrete true, discrete palette returned. Otherwise, continuous palette. reverse true, order palette reversed. col_list Provide vector colors parameter palette="custom". ... arguments passed discrete_scale

title: Create a constructor for ggplot for lines, points, etc. — scale_color_statworx
text: Scale constructor ggplot.

title: Create a constructor for ggplot for lines, points, etc. — scale_color_statworx
code: ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Width, Sepal.Length, color = Species)) + geom_point() + scale_color_statworx()

text: Create constructor ggplot box plots, bar plots, etc.

title: Create a constructor for ggplot for box plots, bar plots, etc. — scale_fill_statworx
code: scale_fill_statworx(   palette = "statworx_standards_1",   discrete = TRUE,   reverse = FALSE,   col_list = c(),   ... )

title: Create a constructor for ggplot for box plots, bar plots, etc. — scale_fill_statworx
text: palette color palette. discrete true, discrete palette returned. Otherwise, continuous palette. reverse true, order palette reversed. col_list Provide vector colors parameter palette="custom". ... arguments passed discrete_scale

title: Create a constructor for ggplot for box plots, bar plots, etc. — scale_fill_statworx
text: Scale constructor ggplot.

title: Create a constructor for ggplot for box plots, bar plots, etc. — scale_fill_statworx
code: ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Width, Sepal.Length, color = Species)) + geom_point() +  scale_fill_statworx()

what: statworx Theme based on theme_classic — statworx_blue
title: statworx Theme based on theme_classic — statworx_blue
text: Sets pre-defined theme standard ggplot theme via theme_classic

title: statworx Theme based on theme_classic — statworx_blue
text: font set default font

title: statworx Theme based on theme_classic — statworx_blue
code: if (FALSE) { library(statworxTheme) statworx_blue() ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Width, Sepal.Length, color = Species)) + geom_point() }
